pageContent:
Schedule 3.7 
 
Arbitration Agreement 
 
As a condition of the services I am providing to [Supplier name] (together with its direct or 
indirect subsidiaries and affiliates, the “Company”) as a third party contractor employed by 
Geometric  Results,  Inc.  (“GRI”),  I  agree  to  the  following  provisions  of  this  Arbitration 
Agreement (this “Agreement”):  
ARBITRATION AGREEMENT 
A. Arbitration. IN CONSIDERATION OF THE SERVICES THAT I AM 
PROVIDING  TO  THE  COMPANY  AS    A  THIRD  PARTY  CONTRACTOR,  THE 
COMPANY’S PROMISE TO ARBITRATE ANY AND ALL DISPUTES WITH ME,  I 
AGREE THAT ANY AND ALL CONTROVERSIES, CLAIMS, OR DISPUTES THAT 
I  MAY  HAVE  WITH  ANYONE  (INCLUDING  THE  COMPANY  AND  ANY 
EMPLOYEE,  OFFICER,  DIRECTOR,  SHAREHOLDER,  OR  BENEFIT  PLAN  OF 
THE COMPANY, IN THEIR CAPACITY AS SUCH OR OTHERWISE), EXCEPT AS 
STATED BELOW, ARISING OUT OF, RELATING TO, OR RESULTING FROM THE 
SERVICES THAT I AM PROVIDING TO THE COMPANY AS  A THIRD PARTY

STATED BELOW, ARISING OUT OF, RELATING TO, OR RESULTING FROM THE 
SERVICES THAT I AM PROVIDING TO THE COMPANY AS  A THIRD PARTY 
CONTRACTOR, OR MY RELATIONSHIP WITH THE COMPANY AS  A THIRD 
PARTY  CONTRACTOR,  OR  THE  TERMINATION  OF  MY  SERVICES  OR 
RELATIONSHIP WITH THE COMPANY AS  A THIRD PARTY CONTRACTOR,, 
INCLUDING  ANY  BREACH  OF  THIS  AGREEMENT,  SHALL  BE  SUBJECT  TO 
BINDING  ARBITRATION  UNDER  THE  FEDERAL  ARBITRATION  ACT.  I 
UNDERSTAND THAT I MAY BRING A PROCEEDING AS A PRIVATE ATTORNEY 
GENERAL,  AS  PERMITTED  BY  LAW.  THE  FEDERAL  ARBITRATION  ACT 
GOVERNS THIS AGREEMENT AND SHALL CONTINUE TO APPLY WITH FULL 
FORCE  AND  EFFECT,  NOTWITHSTANDING  THE  APPLICATION  OF 
PROCEDURAL  RULES  SET  FORTH  IN  THE  APPLICABLE  CIVIL  PRACTICE 
RULES AND STATE LAW. I AGREE TO ARBITRATE ANY AND ALL COMMON 
LAW  AND/OR  STATUTORY  CLAIMS  UNDER  LOCAL,  STATE,  OR  FEDERAL

pageContent:

RULES AND STATE LAW. I AGREE TO ARBITRATE ANY AND ALL COMMON 
LAW  AND/OR  STATUTORY  CLAIMS  UNDER  LOCAL,  STATE,  OR  FEDERAL 
LAW, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, CLAIMS UNDER TITLE VII OF THE 
CIVIL RIGHTS ACT OF 1964, THE AMERICANS WITH DISABILITIES ACT OF 
1990, THE AGE DISCRIMINATION IN EMPLOYMENT ACT OF 1967, THE OLDER 
WORKERS  BENEFIT PROTECTION ACT,  THE  WORKER  ADJUSTMENT  AND 
RETRAINING NOTIFICATION ACT, THE FAIR LABOR STANDARDS ACT, THE 
FAMILY AND MEDICAL LEAVE ACT, CLAIMS RELATING TO EMPLOYMENT 
STATUS,  CLASSIFICATION  AND  RELATIONSHIP  WITH  THE  COMPANY 
INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THAT OF A THIRD PARTY CONTRACTOR, 
AND   CLAIMS   OF   HARASSMENT,   DISCRIMINATION,   WRONGFUL 
TERMINATION, AND BREACH OF CONTRACT, EXCEPT AS PROHIBITED BY 
LAW.  WITH RESPECT TO ALL SUCH CLAIMS AND DISPUTES THAT I AGREE 
TO ARBITRATE, I HEREBY EXPRESSLY AGREE TO WAIVE, AND DO WAIVE,

LAW.  WITH RESPECT TO ALL SUCH CLAIMS AND DISPUTES THAT I AGREE 
TO ARBITRATE, I HEREBY EXPRESSLY AGREE TO WAIVE, AND DO WAIVE, 
ANY  RIGHT  TO  A  TRIAL  BY  JURY.  I  FURTHER  UNDERSTAND  THAT  THIS 
AGREEMENT TO ARBITRATE ALSO APPLIES TO ANY DISPUTES THAT THE

ARBITRATION. SIMILARLY, NOTHING IN THIS AGREEMENT PROHIBITS ME 
FROM  ENGAGING  IN  PROTECTED  ACTIVITY,  AS  SET  FORTH  BELOW. 
NEVERTHELESS, I AGREE THAT A COURT OF COMPETENT JURISDICTION

REVOCABILITY OR VALIDITY OF THIS AGREEMENT TO ARBITRATE OR ANY 
PORTION  HEREOF,  AND  SHALL  HAVE  THE  POWER  TO  ENFORCE  ANY 
ARBITRATION AWARD. 
B. Class/Collective Action Waiver.  I HEREBY WAIVE MY RIGHT TO 
COMMENCE,  JOIN  OR  OTHERWISE  PARTICIPATE  IN  ANY  CLASS, 
COLLECTIVE,  AND/OR  REPRESENTATIVE  ACTION(S)  AGAINST  THE 
COMPANY, AS PERMITTED BY LAW.  I UNDERSTAND THAT ANY CLAIMS BY 
ME AGAINST THE COMPANY, OR ANY CLAIMS BY THE COMPANY AGAINST 
ME, MUST BE PURSUED THROUGH INDIVIDUAL ARBITRATION.  
C. Procedure.  I  AGREE  THAT  ANY  ARBITRATION  WILL  BE 
ADMINISTERED BY JUDICIAL ARBITRATION & MEDIATION SERVICES, INC. 
(“JAMS”),  PURSUANT  TO  ITS  ARBITRATION  RULES  &  PROCEDURES  (THE 
“JAMS RULES”), WHICH ARE AVAILABLE AT https://www.jamsadr.com/adr-rules-
procedures/. I AGREE THAT THE ARBITRATOR SHALL HAVE THE POWER TO 
DECIDE ANY MOTIONS BROUGHT BY ANY PARTY TO THE ARBITRATION,

INCLUDING MOTIONS FOR SUMMARY JUDGMENT AND/OR ADJUDICATION, 
AND MOTIONS TO DISMISS/DEMURRERS AND MOTIONS TO STRIKE. I AGREE 
THAT  THE  ARBITRATOR  SHALL  ISSUE  A  WRITTEN  DECISION  ON  THE 
MERITS. I ALSO AGREE THAT THE ARBITRATOR SHALL HAVE THE POWER 
TO  AWARD  ANY  REMEDIES  AVAILABLE  UNDER  APPLICABLE  LAW,  AND 
THAT THE ARBITRATOR MAY AWARD ATTORNEYS’ FEES AND COSTS TO

AGREE THAT THE DECREE OR AWARD RENDERED BY THE ARBITRATOR 
MAY BE ENTERED AS A FINAL AND BINDING JUDGMENT IN ANY COURT 
HAVING  JURISDICTION  THEREOF.  EXCEPT  AS  PROVIDED  UNDER 
CALIFORNIA LAW, I UNDERSTAND THAT TO THE EXTENT ALLOWED UNDER 
OTHER APPLICABLE LAW, THE COMPANY AND I WILL EVENLY DIVIDE ANY

CALIFORNIA LAW, I UNDERSTAND THAT TO THE EXTENT ALLOWED UNDER 
OTHER APPLICABLE LAW, THE COMPANY AND I WILL EVENLY DIVIDE ANY 
AND ALL COSTS FOR ANY ADMINISTRATIVE OR HEARING FEES CHARGED 
BY THE ARBITRATOR OR JAMS EXCEPT THAT I SHALL PAY ANY FILING FEES 
ASSOCIATED  WITH  ANY  ARBITRATION  THAT  I  INITIATE,  BUT  ONLY  SO 
MUCH OF THE FILING FEES AS I WOULD HAVE INSTEAD PAID HAD I FILED A 
COMPLAINT IN A COURT OF LAW. I AGREE THAT THE ARBITRATOR SHALL 
ADMINISTER  AND  CONDUCT  ANY  ARBITRATION  IN  ACCORDANCE  WITH 
THE LAWS OF THE STATE IN WHICH I PRIMARILY PROVIDE SERVICES TO 
THE  COMPANY  AND  THAT  THE  ARBITRATOR  SHALL  APPLY  THE 
SUBSTANTIVE  AND  PROCEDURAL  LAWS  OF  THE  STATE  IN  WHICH  I 
PRIMARILY PROVIDE SERVICES TO THE COMPANY TO ANY DISPUTE OR 
CLAIM, WITHOUT REFERENCE TO RULES OF CONFLICT-OF-LAW.  
D. Remedy. EXCEPT AS PROVIDED BY THE APPLICABLE CIVIL

D. Remedy. EXCEPT AS PROVIDED BY THE APPLICABLE CIVIL

SOLE, EXCLUSIVE, AND FINAL REMEDY FOR ANY DISPUTE BETWEEN ME

F. Third-Party Beneficiaries.  I ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE THAT

THAT I PROVIDE TO THE COMPANY AS A THIRD PARTY CONTRACTOR.

G. Voluntary  Nature  of  Agreement. I ACKNOWLEDGE AND AGREE

H. Provisional     Remedies.  NOTHING  IN  THIS  AGREEMENT 
PRECLUDES  EITHER  PARTY  FROM  SEEKING  PROVISIONAL  REMEDIES

OTHER INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS IN A COURT OF COMPETENT

PROTECTED ACTIVITY NOT PROHIBITED
